title: I want to do a little bit of everything, is that bad?

I'm worried about not being able to specialize enough to be good at anything or getting lost trying to figure out what I really want to do. Is it okay to explore multiple subjects in college or should I focus on finding a single field that I can excel in?

title: Can’t be the only one
self_text: I can't believe my life is over because of a stupid mistake. Like, why did it have to be me? Why do I have to go through all this pain and suffering? It just doesn't seem fair!  I was so close to getting everything I ever wanted. But now...now it's gone. All gone.   I feel like giving up. What's the point of even trying anymore when everything always goes wrong for me?  Is there any hope left? Or am I doomed to live with this regret forever?  I just want it all to end.  I need help. Please.  I don't know what else to do.   I just wanna sleep and never wake up again.  I'm tired of fighting. I'm tired of hurting. I'm tired of being me.   I miss my mom so much. She would know what to say. She always knew how to make things better. But she's not here anymore. And no one else understands. No one cares.   I just want to disappear.  I just want to fade away.  I just want it to stop.   I've been thinking about ending my life. Is that bad? I mean, who would even care if I was gone? My family probably wouldn't even notice. They're too busy with their own lives.   I just don't see a way out. Everything feels hopeless.   I'm scared. So scared.  But at least it would be over. At least I wouldn't have to feel anything anymore.   I'm sorry.  I'm so sorry.  I just can't take it anymore.   I love you all.  Goodbye.

title: AITA for not wanting to go to my cousins wedding?

I told my mom that I don't think i will be able to make it and she got really upset saying that I was being disrespectful to my cousin and our family. I feel like I should get to decide whether or not I attend their wedding.  I know that it might hurt their feelings if I didn't show up but I just don't want to go. Am I the asshole?

title: I can’t get over it…
self_text: I still can’t get over it, like I’m so confused and lost. What happened was horrible and so unfair to me as well as everyone else.  I have a hard time trying to move on from this when there’s no real closure or explanation for why he did what he did and how things ended up the way they did. Like I understand that people make mistakes but I don’t know if I could ever forgive him.  And honestly, I don’t even want to try. I just need to forget everything about him and start fresh with my life.  But I just keep getting stuck in the past and feeling sad and angry.   I wish I could stop thinking about him and all of the bad things that happened between us. It feels like I’m trapped in a loop where I just keep replaying everything in my head over and over again.  I guess I just need some advice on how to move on from this. I know it’s going to take time, but I just want it to be over already.

title: [Serious] I’m not sure if I am still an immigrant after naturalizing, and it is something that has been bothering me for a while now.
self_text: So I immigrated to the US when I was really young. My parents and I got our green cards in 2004. Then in 2018 I became a US citizen. Ever since then I have always felt like I don’t fully fit in anywhere. People ask me where I’m from all the time, and I just say “America”. And they usually look at me weird. Like what? It’s my home!   I feel like there are two sides of me. The side that grew up here, went to school here, speaks English fluently, and loves everything about America. And the other side that still feels very attached to my culture and heritage. I still speak my native language with my family, eat my traditional foods, and celebrate my cultural holidays.  Is it normal to feel this way? Am I still an immigrant even though I’m a citizen? What does it mean to be an American anyway?

title: [Serious] I'm a black woman, and I need to get over my fear of white people...  I hate it that I do, but I can't help it.
self_text: I don't know why I'm like this. It just seems like they are always judging me or looking down on me. I've had bad experiences in the past, but I can't keep letting them affect me.   I want to be able to interact with white people without feeling so uncomfortable. I feel like I'm missing out on a lot of opportunities because of my fear.   Has anyone else ever felt this way? If so, how did you overcome your fear? I am also open to any advice from white people who have had similar experiences with other races. Thanks!

title: I think it's time for me to get a job
self_text: I am a college student and have been doing ok so far without any financial support from my parents, but things are getting tough lately. My dad says that he won't give me money anymore because of my spending habits (I buy a lot of expensive items that I don't need) but I really can't afford it right now. He is very strict and has always wanted me to be financially independent since a young age. But I don't know what to do because I feel like I would only be able to make enough money if I got a job.  My parents keep saying "you should have thought about your finances" or "don't spend all your money on stupid stuff." They just want me to learn the hard way and I hate it when they say these things to me.   I'm not trying to blame them or anything but I just wish that they could see how much pressure there is being a college student. It feels like they are always judging me and never appreciate everything I do. And I hate feeling like I have to live up to their expectations every time I talk to them.   I guess I'll start looking into jobs around campus. Hopefully I can find something that pays well and doesn't take up too much of my time. I'm also considering taking out loans but I'm worried about the interest rates and paying them back later on in life. I wish I had a better plan, but honestly I'm just trying to figure things out as I go along.

title: AITA for not wanting to be friends with my roommate?
self_text: I (21F) am in college and have a roommate, Ashley (20F). We've been roommates for about 3 months now, but I don't really like her. She is very loud, always has people over, never cleans up after herself, and just generally makes the dorm room messy.   I'm trying to study and focus on my classes, so I would appreciate it if she could keep it down at night, but she doesn't seem to care. I've asked her nicely several times to turn the music down or to please clean up after herself, but she always brushes me off and says that I'm being too sensitive.  She also talks about how much money she spends on shopping and going out with her friends. I'm a student who works part-time to pay for my tuition, so I can't afford to do any of those things.  I think she knows that I'm struggling financially, but she still brags about her wealth. It's really annoying and I feel like she's trying to make me feel bad about myself. I'm starting to resent her and I don't want to hang out with her anymore. I've tried to avoid her as much as possible, but it's hard when we live together. I'm considering asking the RA to switch rooms, but I don't know if that's worth it.  AITA for not wanting to be friends with my roommate?

title: AITA for wanting to cut my brother off?
self_text: I'm in my early twenties and still live at home, but I work full time and pay rent. My younger brother is also in his early twenties and doesn't have a job, he is always on the phone with friends or playing video games. My parents let him stay here for free, which is fine by me because they are his parents. But they expect me to help him out when he asks, like buying groceries or paying bills. They say that it's "family" and I should support him. I don't think so.  I feel like they just want to take advantage of me because I am the only one who works. I told them that I can't afford to help him anymore and they got mad at me. My mom said that I was being selfish and ungrateful. Now she won't talk to me. I don't know what to do. I love my family, but I can't keep letting them use me. Should I cut my brother off?  AITA?

It's like they think I'm just stupid or something. I know I'm not. I've played plenty of games before, but this one is just too difficult for me to beat.  I am so frustrated that I want to quit playing altogether. But then I think about all the time and money I've already invested into the game, and I don't want to give up now.  I just wish there were some way to make the game more accessible to players of all skill levels. Or at least, some way to stop the negative comments from other players.  I'm starting to feel like I'm the only one who's struggling with this game, and it's making me question my own abilities as a gamer.  Is anyone else feeling this way?  Any tips or advice would be greatly appreciated.

title: The New York Times, October 26th, 1974 - "The Man Who Fell to Earth"
self_text: A review of Nicolas Roeg's adaptation of Walter Tevis' novel about an alien who comes to Earth seeking water for his dying planet and ends up falling in love with a human woman.  A look at the film that made David Bowie a star.  But is it any good?  In my opinion, yes, but I have to admit, there are some things about it that don't quite work.  For instance, why does Newton make such a big deal out of not eating meat when he eats fish? And what's with all the nudity?  It seems like Roeg was trying too hard to be provocative.  However, the film is visually stunning, and the acting is excellent.  David Bowie gives a brilliant performance as Newton, and Rip Torn is great as Nathan Bryce.  I would recommend this film to anyone who enjoys science fiction or art house cinema.

title: I have a question about my grades in the CS 102 course, and I am not sure if it is an error or not?
self_text: The grade is the sum of two midterm exams (60%) + one final exam (40%).   I did well on both midterms and got 95/100 on each. I also did very well on the final exam and got 98/100.  So my total score should be around (95+95+98) / 3 = 96%.   However, my overall grade for this class is 93% which is C+.   Could you please explain to me why there is such discrepancy between my calculation and the actual grade?  Is this because of some rounding rule that I am unaware of?  Or is it due to the fact that the two midterms were weighted more than the final exam?  If so, how can I get clarification from my professor about this?

title: My wife is the only person I have to talk about my childhood trauma with and it's making me feel worse, what do I do?
self_text: So, my wife and I have been together for over a decade now and she's always been the only person I've really talked to about anything, including some pretty big stuff from my childhood. For context, I grew up in an abusive household where my mom was constantly screaming at me and telling me how worthless I am. She was emotionally manipulative and I never felt like I could ever be good enough for her. When I met my wife, she was so loving and supportive, and she made me feel safe and valued for the first time in my life.  I started opening up to her about my childhood and she listened without judgment. She helped me process my feelings and validated my experiences. However, recently, I've noticed that talking to her about my trauma has actually been making me feel worse instead of better.  Whenever I start talking about my past, she gets really upset and starts trying to fix things or offer solutions. She doesn't seem to understand that sometimes I just need someone to listen and acknowledge my pain.  She also tends to compare my experiences to hers, which makes me feel like my struggles aren't being taken seriously. I know she means well, but her reactions are invalidating and make me feel even more alone.   I'm starting to dread sharing my thoughts and feelings with her because I know it will only lead to disappointment and frustration. I want to continue being vulnerable with her, but I don't know how to communicate my needs effectively without hurting her feelings.   Any advice on how to navigate this situation?  Should I try to find another outlet for processing my trauma, like therapy? Or should I focus on setting boundaries with my wife and teaching her how to provide the support I need?

title: Dungeons and Dragons in the Fallout universe
self_text: I've been thinking about how fun it would be to play a DnD campaign set in the fallout universe, with some changes.  I was thinking of having the DM use the fallout lore as the world setting but make up new rules that could work in the game.   If you were to play DnD in the fallout universe what class would you choose? And what kind of story would you like to explore? What special rules or settings should be added for the game?  Here are my ideas:  Class choices  Ranger - Wanderer/Hunter  Fighter - Mercenary/Soldier  Paladin - Brotherhood of Steel  Barbarian - Tribe member  Cleric - Church of Atom  Monk - The master race  Druid - Animal tamer  Wizard - Researcher  Bard - Radio personality/Story teller  Warlock - Super Mutant  Sorcerer - FEV  Rogue - Scavenger  Artificer - Tinker   Special Rules  Radiation - All characters have a radiation resistance score  Mutations - Characters can gain mutations from radiation exposure  Skills - Skills will be based on S.P.E.C.I.A.L stats  Resources - Resources such as caps, water, food, and ammo will be important  Crafting - Players can craft items using resources they find  Companions - Players can recruit companions to help them on their journey  Factions - Players can join factions and complete quests for them   Story Ideas  Explore a pre-war vault  Investigate a mysterious signal  Help a settlement defend against raiders  Search for lost technology  Uncover a conspiracy within the government  Discover the truth about the bombs  Rebuild society after the apocalypse

title: The only way to get over a breakup is to cut off all contact with the ex, even if you still love them.
self_text: I think there are exceptions to that rule. It's important to remember why you broke up in the first place and not romanticize the past.  If you're able to do that, then maybe it's possible to stay friends with your ex. But for most people, cutting off all contact is the best way to move on.   I'm really hurt by the breakup and I want to see her again but she doesn't seem interested. Maybe I should just let her go?

title: I’m very confused about how to apply for college
self_text: So, I've been researching and trying to get all my stuff ready for applying to colleges. But it’s confusing as hell.  I'm a junior in high school, but the school counselor is always busy and doesn't seem to know what she's talking about (maybe because she's so overwhelmed with work). So I’m kinda on my own here.   First of all, what are all the things I need to do?  I've heard you have to take an ACT/SAT test, which I'm taking next year. But what else do I need to do? Do I also have to go around visiting schools? How much will that cost?? I don't really understand if I need to start doing any of these steps now or later.   Also, where can I find information on scholarships? And what kind of GPA do I need to have?  Any advice would be appreciated.  Thanks!

title: I'm not sure if I can stay here anymore.
self_text: I've been going to school for over 5 years now and I still don't have a job or career. My parents are getting sick of me and want me to get out of the house but I just can't seem to get my life together. I'm afraid that I'll never be able to provide for myself, let alone anyone else. I'm thinking about dropping out of college and moving back home with my parents, but I'm scared that I'll just end up being a burden on them forever.  I feel like I'm stuck in a rut and I don't know how to get out of it. I wish there was someone who could help me figure things out, but I don't even know where to start.   I just want to be happy again.

title: [Serious] I am in a very bad place with my boyfriend and I don’t know what to do
self_text: I feel like he does not care about me or how I feel, but when I bring it up he says that’s not true. He is always busy and when we are together he only wants to talk about himself and his problems. He is also super critical of everything I do and makes me feel worthless. I have tried talking to him multiple times about these things but he just dismisses my feelings and tells me I’m being dramatic.  I am starting to wonder if I should just end the relationship but I love him so much and I don’t want to be alone.  Is there anything I can do to save this relationship?   Edit: Thanks for all your advice! I think you are right, I need to focus on myself and my own happiness. It’s hard to accept that he doesn’t appreciate me or care about my feelings, but I deserve someone who does. I am going to take some time apart from him and see if that helps. If not, I will break up with him. I am scared but I know it’s the right thing to do.  I really appreciate everyone taking the time to read my story and offer their support. You guys are the best!

title: The 5 Best Cars in the Game (Based on Stats)
self_text: Here are my top picks for cars that excel in terms of stats and performance in the game, along with a brief explanation of why they stand out:  1. Ferrari FXX K – 900 hp, 720 lb-ft of torque, 346 mph top speed, 1.7 sec 0-60 time   The Ferrari FXX K is a beast on the track, offering incredible acceleration and top speed. Its powerful engine and advanced aerodynamics make it a formidable competitor.  2. Lamborghini Centenario – 770 hp, 507 lb-ft of torque, 217 mph top speed, 2.7 sec 0-60 time   The Lamborghini Centenario is known for its stunning design and exceptional handling. It provides a smooth and controlled driving experience, making it ideal for both beginners and experienced racers.  3. McLaren P1 – 903 hp, 664 lb-ft of torque, 217 mph top speed, 2.8 sec 0-60 time   The McLaren P1 boasts impressive power and agility, allowing drivers to navigate tight corners with ease. Its hybrid powertrain delivers instant torque and lightning-fast acceleration.  4. Porsche 918 Spyder – 887 hp, 944 lb-ft of torque, 214 mph top speed, 2.6 sec 0-60 time   The Porsche 918 Spyder combines raw power with precision engineering. It offers a balanced and responsive ride, making it a joy to drive on any surface.  5. Bugatti Chiron Super Sport 300+ – 1600 hp, 1180 lb-ft of torque, 304 mph top speed, 3.5 sec 0-60 time   The Bugatti Chiron Super Sport 300+ is the epitome of luxury and performance. Its massive engine and aerodynamic design deliver unparalleled speed and stability.  These cars represent the pinnacle of automotive engineering, offering an exhilarating driving experience that will leave you breathless.  #cars #performance #luxury #speed #automotive  If you have any questions or would like to discuss these cars further, feel free to ask!
